title: Optimize CI binary compilation time
description:
Investigate and implement CI optimizations for Tauri build:

Quick wins identified:
1. Add .cargo/config.toml with thin LTO and codegen-units
2. Add sccache for cross-run compilation caching
3. Split macOS universal binary into parallel arch jobs
4. Optimize Swatinem/rust-cache configuration

Estimated savings: 30-50% on incremental builds

title: Setup Mailpit for dev/staging email capture
description: Setup Mailpit to capture emails in development and staging environments instead of sending real emails.

title: Add persistent logging with tauri-plugin-log
description: Added tauri-plugin-log for persistent logging to platform log directories. Logs to stdout and file.

title: Generate Tauri update signing keypair and add to GitHub secrets
description:
Generate Tauri signing keypair for update verification:
1. Run: pnpm tauri signer generate -w ~/.tauri/nebula.key
2. Store private key securely (backup!)
3. Add to GitHub secrets:
   - TAURI_SIGNING_PRIVATE_KEY
   - TAURI_SIGNING_PRIVATE_KEY_PASSWORD
4. Embed public key in tauri.conf.json updater config

This is separate from Apple code signing - it's for the app to verify updates are authentic.

description: Public-facing marketing website for Project Nebula

title: Add AI-powered release notes and version suggestions
description:
Create a /release-desktop skill that:
- Analyzes commits since last desktop-v* tag
- Uses Claude to suggest semver bump (patch/minor/major) based on conventional commits
- Generates grouped release notes (features, fixes, etc.)
- Passes title/description to release-desktop.sh
- Updates GitHub release page with the notes

Future: backfill existing releases with generated notes

Design discussion started in conversation - decided on local Claude analysis (not CI).

title: Add CI pipelines for tests and checks
description:
Set up GitHub Actions CI pipelines that run on:
- Every PR
- Every push to master/main

Pipelines should include:
- TypeScript type-checking (just check)
- Rust code checks for the updater (cargo check, cargo clippy, cargo test)
- Unit tests for all packages
- Build verification

The Rust CI is especially important since we added updater functionality.

title: Set up Apple code signing and notarization
description:
Reactivate Apple Developer account and configure macOS code signing + notarization for desktop app releases. Requires:
- Active Apple Developer Program membership ($99/year)
- Developer ID Application certificate
- Developer ID Installer certificate
- App-specific password for notarization
- Add signing secrets to GitHub Actions

title: Work out beta/dev release strategy
description:
Figure out how to handle beta releases or dev releases for the desktop app. Consider:
- Version numbering scheme (e.g., 1.0.0-beta.1)
- Separate update channels
- How users opt-in to beta
- Distribution method

title: Startup log shows hardcoded v0.1.0 instead of actual version
description: The startup log message in nebula_desktop_lib shows 'Project Nebula v0.1.0 starting...' regardless of actual version. Should read version dynamically from Cargo.toml or use env\!('CARGO_PKG_VERSION').

title: Create fake email provider for dev/staging
description:
Create a mock email provider that can be used in development and staging environments instead of sending real emails.

Requirements:
- Can send to any email address without actually delivering
- All sent emails are stored and viewable in a list
- Renders the actual email content that would have been sent
- Easy to switch between fake and real provider based on environment

Black screen on production builds - frontend not loading
description: When opening the app from an official download (DMG), the window shows a black screen. Local dev works fine. Frontend console logs not appearing in Rust logger, suggesting JS either fails to load or crashes before attachConsole(). Added debug logging in index.html to diagnose in next release.
